intro: Leleba amahussana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Leleba amahussana thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
